links.title: Samsung SDI Battery Tech On Display At NAIAS - 373-Mile Range, 20-Minute Charge
links.description: Samsung SDI presents at the North American International Auto Show all sorts of battery products under its "The Future of Electric Vehicles Starts Today" slogan. The key promise is new batteries that enables 600 km (373 miles) range and at the same time 20-minute recharge, which to our knowledge would require power of 300 kW or so.

links.title: Ford to increase electric vehicle investment to $11 billion: executive
links.description: (Reuters) - Ford Motor Co () will increase to $11 billion its investments in electric vehicles, Jim Farley, the company's head of global markets, said on Sunday at the Detroit auto show. Farley said Ford will bring a high performance electric utility vehicle to market by 2020.

links.title: Forget Kodak, UrbanImmersive Is The Next Ethereum Miner To Pop
links.description: Eastman Kodak (KODK) has been on a tear, up 171%, since it announced that it will be doing an initial coin offering for an image rights management platform. The only thing that has printed easier money than KodakCoin recently has been the Canadian junior market, particularly in cannabis and blockchain.

links.title: 18 Stocks And ETFs To Watch In 2018
links.description: Wall Street is off to a roaring start so far in 2018, but investors still have a long way to go. The S&P 500 gained 20 percent in 2017, but some stocks did much better than others in 2017. Here's Benzinga's list of 18 stocks and ETFs investors should be watching closely this year.

links.title: Tesla vehicles were set on fire in apparent act of anti-EV vandalism
links.description: Tesla has more than its fair share of naysayers, but it's generally limited to some nasty internet comments or in the worst cases, some legislation preventing them from selling their cars directly to customers. Now it looks like some people are taking it to a new level as Tesla vehicles were set on fire in an apparent anti-EV/Tesla vandalism act.

messages.body: $TSLA Instinet analyst Romit Shah says Tesla is a buy, because new production targets are finally beatable. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-analyst-easy-production-comps-will-soon-benefit-tesla-inc-tsla/

links.title: Analyst: Easy Production Comps Will Soon Benefit Tesla Inc (TSLA)
links.description: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has finally gotten realistic about its EV production targets, and combined with weak year-over-year comps, the company should provide some upside surprises soon. That's according to Instinet analyst Romit Shah, who published a bullish note about TSLA to clients recently.

links.title: Ford Set to Double Down to $11 Billion on Electric Vehicle Investment
links.description: http://bit.ly/2mwA7sY Ford Motor Company (NYSE:F ) is more than doubling its spending on electric vehicles, committing $11 billion through 2022. F stock is up almost 6% in the new year. The news came during yesterday's opening press conference at the annual North American International Auto Show in Detroit.

links.title: Jan-16-2018 - Market Recap and Next Day Review - Weekend Edition
links.description: The markets continued their strong run making new all-time or multi-year highs across the board. Year-end targets are now within striking distance only two weeks into January. In the midst of all this, our market breadth indicators maintain their cautioned stance for price action ahead.
